summary: Email correspondence between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing draft motions in limine (MILs) for the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The emails show collaborative editing and review of legal filings ahead of trial.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sender of the email attaching draft motions in limine for the Maxwell case and requesting feedback from colleagues.

events.title: Drafting of Maxwell Motions in Limine
events.description: Assistant United States Attorneys exchange emails and draft motions in limine (MILs) for the Ghislaine Maxwell case, with collaborative editing and review.

events.title: Final Review of Maxwell MILs
events.description: Prosecutors continue to exchange edited drafts and comments on the motions in limine for the Maxwell case, indicating preparation for upcoming trial proceedings.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors in the Southern District of New York were actively preparing motions in limine for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial in October 2021.
The email chain shows collaborative legal drafting and review processes among Assistant United States Attorneys.
The correspondence indicates a 'packed calendar' suggesting intensive pre-trial preparation.
The document reveals the prosecution's office location at 1 Saint Andrews Plaza in New York.
Multiple drafts of motions were being circulated and edited with track changes and comment bubbles.
